entries: Arioch Morningstar can use his action to magically assume the shape of a brown bear,  raven, or wolf. Arioch Morningstar regains expended uses when he finishes a short or long rest.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Arioch Morningstar makes three longsword attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The ebon spirit's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). The ebon spirit can cast the following spells innately, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The ebon spirit can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Light Sensitivity
entries: While in bright light, the ebon spirit has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the ebon spirit can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

action.name: Ebon Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@dice 1d6 + 2}) psychic  damage. The target must make a successful {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed}.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The echo of demonkind's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). The echo of demonkind can cast the following spells innately, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The echo of demonkind can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Light Hypersensitivity
entries: While in bright light, the echo of demonkind has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The echo of demonkind has advantage on all saving throws imposed by magical effects.

action.name: Ebon Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@dice 1d6 + 3}) psychic  damage. The target must make a successful {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed}.

action.name: Possession
entries: One humanoid that the echo of demonkind can see within 5 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw or be possessed by it. The echo of demonkind then disappears, and the target is {@condition incapacitated} and takes control of its body. The echo of demonkind now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. The echo of demonkind can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}. It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies.

The possession lasts 3 turns, until the body drops to 0 hit points, or until the echo of demonkind ends it as a bonus action. When the possession ends, the echo of demonkind reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. The target takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) psychic damage and expends three random spell slots if the target has any available once the possession ends.
The target is immune to this Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Garion is a 5th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). He has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Song of Insanity (3/Day)
entries: Garion can use an action to sing a song (in Abyssal). Any creature within 60 feet of Garion that can hear him must make a successful {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw, coming under the effects of the {@spell confusion} spell on a failed save. If the creature fails its save by 5 or more, it is affected by madness (roll on the Short-Term Madness table).

trait.name: Surrogate of the Devil
entries: Garion's mind has been warped by demonic influence. Garion has disadvantage on all Charisma saving throws and skill checks when interacting with demons. If Garion fails a saving throw or skill check when interacting with a demon, he is {@condition charmed} by the demon and under its control. At the end of each turn Garion may make an additional saving throw, ending the effect but becoming {@condition frightened} of the demon until the end of his next turn. Raz'Drexin may also possess Garion's body at will. If Garion is reduced to 0 hit points while possessed by Raz'Drexin, Raz'Drexin takes 22 ({@damage 4d10}) psychic damage.

While Garion is possessed by Raz'Drexin, he has advantage on all Charisma saving throws and skill checks, gains resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons, and deals critical damage on attack rolls of 19 or 20. Any creature within 60 feet of Garion while he is possessed by Raz'Drexin makes saving throws against any of Garion's spell effects with disadvantage.

trait.name: Tormented Blessing
entries: While Garion is possessed by Raz'Drexin, his AC includes his charisma modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Garion makes three dagger attacks.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit 4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Rebuff the Devil
entries: If Garion is possessed by Raz'Drexin and hit with an attack or spell that deals radiant damage, he can make a {@dc 15} Constitution  saving throw. On a success, Garion is free from Raz'Drexin possession, and can't be possessed by Raz'Drexin again until the end of Garion's next turn.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Raz'Drexin is an 11th-level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). Each spell is cast as a 5th-level spell, and Raz'Drexin regains their expended spell slots when they finish a short or long rest. Raz'Drexin knows the following spells:

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: Raz'Drexin can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. Raz'Drexin takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Light Hypersensitivity
entries: While in bright light, Raz'Drexin has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Raz'Drexin makes two ebon touch attacks, or one attack with its tendrils of darkness.

action.name: Ebon Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}12 ({@dice 2d6 + 5}) psychic  damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed}.

action.name: Tendrils of Darkness
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 8} to hit, range 60 ft., one creature. {@h}27 ({@damage 5d8 + 5}) necrotic damage. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Possession
entries: One Humanoid that Raz'Drexin can see within 5 ft. of it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or be possessed by Raz'Drexin; Raz'Drexin then disappears, and the target is {@condition incapacitated} and loses control of its body. Raz'Drexin now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. Raz'Drexin can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, and Raz'Drexin retains its Alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}. It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics.

The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, until Raz'Drexin ends it as a bonus action, or Raz'Drexin is forced out by an effect like the {@spell dispel evil and good} spell. When the possession ends, Raz'Drexin reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. The target takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) psychic damage and expends its three highest spell slots if it has spell slots once the possession ends.
The target is immune to this Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.
Raz'Drexin can possess Garion at will, requiring no action. Garion automatically fails the saving throw to avoid being possessed by Raz'Drexin.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Avilnar is an 11th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks. Avilnar has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: Creatures have disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws while attempting to pierce Avilnar's illusions, and she can use her sneak attack ability while disguised within an illusion.

trait.name: Cunning and Manipulative
entries: Avilnar has advantage on Charisma (Deception, Performance, Persuasion) checks when interacting with intelligent creatures of lawful or chaotic alignments.

trait.name: Free Mind
entries: Avilnar is immune to being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}, and has resistance to psychic damage. She also has advantage on Intelligence (Investigation) and Wisdom (Perception) checks to detect illusions.

trait.name: Keen Observer
entries: Avilnar has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks while observing other creatures' behaviors.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: Avilnar deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage when she hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally that isn't incapacitated and Avilnar doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Avilnar makes four attacks with her daggers.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Faradel is an 11th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks. Faradel has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Chaotic Mind
entries: Faradel has advantage on Charisma (Intimidation, Persuasion) checks when interacting with chaotic-aligned creatures.

trait.name: Necromantic Power
entries: Faradel deals critical damage on spell attack rolls of 19 or 20 on spells cast from the school of necromancy.

trait.name: Undead Affinity
entries: An undead creature within 30 feet of Faradel deals critical damage on attack rolls of 19 or 20 and has advantage on saving throws made against the turn undead ability.

trait.name: Weapon of the Damned
entries: Faradel wields a sickle of pure necrotic energy that dissipates if she is reduced to 0 hit points. It can be summoned into existence or dismissed as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Faradel makes two attacks with her sickle of the damned.

action.name: Sickle of the Damned
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) slashing damage plus 10 ({@damage 4d4}) necrotic damage.

trait.name: Giant Form
entries: As a bonus action, Flipper can grow to a Large size for 1 minute. While in this giant form, he deals additional damage (see below) and has advantage on Strength ability checks and saving throws.

trait.name: Grappler
entries: Any creature {@condition grappled} by Flipper takes {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage at the start of their turn. If a creature is {@condition grappled} by Flipper while in giant form they make Strength checks to break free with disadvantage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Flipper makes two attacks with his flippers.

action.name: Flipper
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage ({@dice 2d8 + 5} if in giant form). If the target is a creature they must make a Strength saving throw or become {@condition grappled}. Flipper cannot make any attacks while grappling a target.

reaction.name: Flipper Smack
entries: If an enemy triggers an opportunity attack while Flipper is in giant form and takes damage as the result of this attack, their movement speed becomes 0 and they are {@condition stunned} until the start of their next turn.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Kyreen is a 12th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). She has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Aura of Protection
entries: Any friendly creature within 30 feet of Kyreen has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened} and gains a +1 bonus to their armor class while Kyreen is conscious.

trait.name: Disciple of Order
entries: Kyreen has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}. She also has advantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks when interacting with lawful-aligned creatures, but disadvantage on Charisma (Deception) checks when interacting with chaotic-aligned creatures.

trait.name: Divine Smite
entries: When Kyreen hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, she can expend one spell slot to deal an additional {@damage 2d8} radiant damage for a 1st-level spell slot, plus {@damage 1d8} radiant damage for each spell slot higher than 1st.

trait.name: Radiant Power
entries: Kyreen deals critical damage on spell or melee attack rolls of 19 or 20 on that deal radiant damage.

trait.name: Turn Unholy
entries: Kyreen brandishes her holy symbol and speaks a prayer against undead. Each undead creature within 30 feet that can see or hear her must make a Wisdom saving throw. If it fails its saving throw it is turned for 1 minute or until it takes damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Kryeen makes three attacks with her warhammer of radiance.

action.name: Maul of Radiance
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Blessed Hands (1/Day)
entries: Using an action, Kyreen touches a willing creature within 5 feet of her, healing them for 30 hit points. The creature is also cured of any disease or poison affecting it, and adds {@dice 1d4} to all attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws for 1 hour. If Kyreen touches an undead creature on a successful attack roll, the undead creature takes 30 radiant damage and is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

monster.name: Risen Mage
languages: understands Inmortui plus languages it knew in life

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The risen mage's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 11}, {@hit 3} to hit with spell attacks). It can cast the following spells innately, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Chaotic Eruption
entries: If the risen mage is reduced to 0 hit points or has a spell backfire, its chaotic essence violently discharges. Any creature within 10 feet must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or take 11 ({@damage 2d10}) damage of a random damage type (roll a {@dice d6}: 1=cold; 2=fire; 3=lightning; 4=necrotic, 5=acid; 6=thunder) and be {@condition stunned} until the end of the creature's next turn.

trait.name: Gesticulating Caster
entries: The risen mage is able to cast spells using only a somatic component.

trait.name: Unstable Casting
entries: If the risen mage rolls a 1 or 2 on a spell attack roll, its spell backfires, causing a chaotic eruption (see above).

action.name: Chaos Arrow
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 3} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d10}) damage of a random type (roll a {@dice d6}: 1=cold; 2=fire; 3=lightning; 4=necrotic, 5=acid; 6=thunder).

monster.name: Risen Warrior
languages: understands Inmortui plus languages it knew in life

trait.name: Chaotic Eruption
entries: If the risen mage is reduced to 0 hit points, its chaotic essence violently discharges. Any creature within 10 feet must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or take 11 ({@damage 2d10}) damage of a random damage type (roll a {@dice d6}: 1=cold; 2=fire; 3=lightning; 4=necrotic, 5=acid; 6=thunder) and be {@condition stunned} until the end of the creature's next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The risen warrior uses its Insane Laugh (if able) and then makes one longsword attack.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage of a random type (roll a {@dice d6}: 1=cold; 2=fire; 3=lightning; 4=necrotic, 5=acid; 6=thunder).

action.name: Insane Laugh {@recharge}
entries: The risen warrior emits an insane burst of laughter. Each creature of the risen warrior's choosing within 30 feet of it that can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or use its reaction to move its movement speed in a random direction. To determine the direction, roll a {@dice d8} and assign a direction to each die face.

monster.name: Stitchwork Golem

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't adamantine

languages: understands Inmortui plus languages it knew in life

trait.name: Aversion to Light
entries: The stitchwork golem has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws made while in daylight or bright light. If it takes radiant damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Berserk
entries: If the stitchwork golem's creator drops below half their maximum hit points, the stitchwork golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem will select a random creature it can see, and move to attack it. While berserk the golem deals an additional {@damage 1d8} damage and deals critical damage on attack rolls of 19 or 20. The stitchwork golem will focus on its selected target until it is reduced to 0 hit points before selecting a new target. If there are no creatures nearby it will attack an object, with a preference for objects smaller than itself. The golem's berserk state ends if its creator regains hit points to a value over half its maximum.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The stitchwork golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The stitchwork golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The stitchwork golem makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (1/Day)
headerEntries: Borr's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 11}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: When Borr dies, they explode in a burst of jagged ice. Each creature within 5 feet of them must make a {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw, taking 4 ({@damage 1d8}) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While Borr remains motionless, they are indistinguishable from an ordinary shard of ice.

trait.name: Limited Telepathy
entries: Borr can communicate with any sentient creature they can see within 120 feet on Jarl Hjálmŷr's floor.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) slashing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) cold damage.

action.name: Frost Breath {@recharge}
entries: The mephit exhales a 15-foot cone of cold air. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw, taking 5 ({@damage 2d4}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Limited Teleportation {@recharge 5}
entries: Borr can teleport anywhere on Jarl Hjálmŷr's floor, disappearing and reappearing in a puff of fog.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The Draugr regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn. If the Draugr takes fire or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: When the Draugr's body is destroyed, its soul lingers. After 24 hours, Karthax restores its soul into a new corpse within the tower. The corpse regains all its hit points.

trait.name: Servant's Link
entries: The Draugr is telepathically linked to Jarl Hjálmŷr, and can sense his emotions. If Jarl Hjálmŷr is {@condition frightened}, the Draugr is {@condition incapacitated} for the duration of this effect.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Draugr makes two greataxe attacks.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Edmond is a 5th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). Edmond has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Cowardly
entries: Edmond can take the Disengage or Hide actions as a bonus action on his turn.

trait.name: Skald's Inspiration
entries: As a bonus action on his turn, Edmond can choose one creature within 60 feet of him that Edmond can see, and inspires it with a carefully chosen verse or phrase. For 1 minute, the creature makes saving throws and attack rolls with advantage.

trait.name: Song of Rest
entries: Edmond can perform a song while taking a short rest. Any creature of Edmond's choice who hears the song regains an extra {@dice 1d6} hit points if it spends any Hit Dice to regain hit points at the end of that rest. Edmond can confer this benefit on himself as well.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Egotistical
entries: Jarl Hjálmŷr has advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks but disadvantage on Charisma (Deception, Performance, Persuasion) checks.

trait.name: Fear of Flames
entries: If Jarl Hjálmŷr starts his turn within 5 feet of a source of fire (magical or nonmagical), he makes attack rolls and saving throws with disadvantage on that turn. If magical or nonmagical flames appear within 10 feet of him, he must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of the flames for 1 minute.  Jarl Hjálmŷr can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of his turns, ending the effect on a success. If the flames persist for more than one turn, Jarl Hjálmŷr has advantage on subsequent saving throws.

trait.name: Jarl's Fury (1/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, Jarl Hjálmŷr can enter a rage that lasts for 1 minute. While raging, Jarl Hjálmŷr gains advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls and deals critical damage on attack rolls of 19 or 20, but has disadvantage on all saving throws.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Jarl Hjálmŷr makes two greataxe attacks.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 3d12 + 6}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Counter
entries: When Jarl Hjálmŷr is hit with an attack that deals critical damage, he can use his reaction to make a greataxe attack against a target within range.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (1/Day)
headerEntries: Rán's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 11}, {@hit 3} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: When Rán dies, they explode in a burst of jagged ice. Each creature within 5 feet of them must make a {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw, taking 4 ({@damage 1d8}) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While Rán remains motionless, they are indistinguishable from an ordinary shard of ice.

trait.name: Limited Telepathy
entries: Rán can communicate with any sentient creature they can see within 120 feet on Jarl Hjálmŷr's floor.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) slashing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) cold damage.

action.name: Frost Breath {@recharge}
entries: The mephit exhales a 15-foot cone of cold air. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw, taking 5 ({@damage 2d4}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Limited Teleportation {@recharge 5}
entries: Rán can teleport anywhere on Jarl Hjálmŷr's floor, disappearing and reappearing in a burst of ice shards.

trait.name: Action Surge (Recharges After a Short or Long Rest)
entries: After taking an action on his turn, Rorak can take one additional action.

trait.name: Bold
entries: Rorak has advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) saving throws.

trait.name: Fearless
entries: Rorak has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Second Wind (Recharges After a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, Rorak can regain 16 hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Rorak makes two attacks with his greatsword.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature.  {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: Varsúlfr has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Loyal Mind
entries: Varsúlfr has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: Varsúlfr has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one Varsúlfr's allies is within 5 feet of them and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Snow Camouflage
entries: The Varsúlfr has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in snowy terrain.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Cold Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: Varsúlfr exhales a blast of freezing wind in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Indomitable Spirit
entries: Artuk has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened} and on Charisma saving throws.

trait.name: Massive Weapon Defense
entries: While Artukis is wielding a two-handed weapon, his AC includes his Strength modifier.

trait.name: Rage
entries: As a bonus action on his turn, Artuk can enter into a rage that lasts for 1 minute. While raging, Artuk gains advantage on all melee attack rolls, saving throws, and strength checks. When making a melee weapon attack using Strength, Artuk gains a +2 bonus to the damage roll.
The rage ends if Artuk is knocked {@condition unconscious} or if his turn ends and he hasn't attacked a hostile creature since his last turn or taken damage since then.

trait.name: Reckless Attack
entries: At the start of his turn, Artuk can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against him have advantage until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Artuk makes two attacks with his maul.

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The cultist's spellcasting ability is Charisa (spell save {@dc 11}, {@hit 3} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells:

trait.name: Devout
entries: The cultist has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}, and on Charisma (Deception, Persuasion) checks when interacting with evil or chaotic aligned creatures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cultist makes three melee attacks: two with its scimitar and one with its dagger

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) slashing damage.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Devout of Khuzza
entries: Jouslir has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}, and on Charisma (Intimidation) checks.

trait.name: Devastating Blows
entries: When Jouslir hits with a melee weapon attack against a {@condition prone} target, the attack deals critical damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Jouslir makes three attacks with his blade arm and one with his axe.

action.name: Axe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Blade Arm
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Felling Blow
entries: If Jouslir is targeted by a melee weapon attack from a creature within 5 feet of him that he can see and the attack misses, Jouslir can shove his attacker, knocking them {@condition prone} on a successful contested Strength (Athletics) check.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: Khuzza can hold its breath for 1 hour.

trait.name: Multiple Heads
entries: Khuzza has five heads. While it has more than one head, Khuzza has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.
Whenever Khuzza takes 30 or more damage in a single turn, one of its heads dies. If all its heads die, Khuzza dies.

At the end of its turn, it grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn, unless it has taken fire damage since its last turn. Khuzza regains 10 hit points for each head regrowth this way.

trait.name: Reactive Heads
entries: For each head Khuzza has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only for opportunity attacks.

trait.name: Wakeful
entries: While Khuzza sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Khuzza makes as many bite attacks as it has heads.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit 10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) piercing damage. If the creature is Medium or smaller sized, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be caught in the jaws of one of Khuzza's heads (considered {@condition grappled}). Khuzza's next two melee attacks against the target are made with advantage, after which it is dropped and the grapple automatically ends.

If a Small-sized target fails its save by 5 or more, it is swallowed whole. While in Khuzza's stomach, the target takes 6 ({@damage 1d12}) acid damage per turn until it is reduced to 0 hit points or freed from Khuzza's stomach.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The swarm has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny quipper. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The swarm can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Bites (swarm has more than half HP)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature in the swarm's space. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Bites (swarm has half HP or less)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature in the swarm's space. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Tiarsus Tralee is an 8th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). Tiarsus has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: On each of her turns, Tiarsus Tralee can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Favored Enemy:
entries: Beasts and Giants. Tiarsus Tralee has advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track her favored enemies, as well as on Intelligence (History) checks to recall information about them.

trait.name: Keen Senses
entries: Tiarsus Tralee has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

trait.name: Master Marksman
entries: Tiarsus Tralee deals critical damage on ranged attacks on a roll of 19 or 20. Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on her ranged attack rolls.

trait.name: Natural Explorer
entries: When travelling in forested areas, Tiarsus Tralee and her group cannot become lost except by magical means and difficult terrain doesn't slow the group's travel.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Tiarsus makes two melee or ranged attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit 7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Veraetis is an 11th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). Each spell is cast as a 5th-level spell, and Veraetis regains expended spell slots when she finishes a short or long rest. She knows the following spells:

trait.name: Agonizing Blast
entries: Veraetis adds her Charisma modifier to damage dealt with her eldritch blast (included in the attack).

trait.name: Armor of Shadows
entries: Veraetis can cast {@spell mage armor} on herself at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

trait.name: Beguiling Influence
entries: Veraetis has advantage on Charisma (Deception, Persuasion) checks.

trait.name: Demon Sight
entries: Veraetis can see normally in darkness, both magical and nonmagical, to a distance of 120 ft.
Pact of Raz'Drexin. Veraetis can cast the spells darkness and hellish rebuke without expending a spell slot or using material components.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Veraetis makes three eldritch blast attacks.

action.name: Eldritch Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 7} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) force damage.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage or 5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage when wielded with two hands.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Acythylass can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Mucus Cloud
entries: While underwater, Acythylass is surrounded by transformative mucus. A creature that touches Acythylass or that hits them with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature is diseased for {@dice 1d4} hours. The diseased creature can breathe only underwater.

trait.name: Probing Telepathy
entries: If a creature communicates telepathically with Acythylass, Acythylass learns the creature's greatest desires.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Acythylass makes three tentacle attacks.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or become diseased. The disease has no effect for 1 minute and can be removed by any magic that cures disease.

After 1 minute, the diseased creature's skin becomes translucent and slimy, the creature can't regain hit points unless it is underwater, and the disease can be removed only by heal or another disease-curing spell of 6th-level or higher. When the creature is outside a body of water, it takes 6 ({@damage 1d12}) acid damage every 10 minutes unless moisture is applied to the skin before 10 minutes have passed.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft. one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Enslave (3/Day)
entries: Acythylass targets one creature they can see within 30 feet of them. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be magically {@condition charmed} by Acythylass until Acythylass dies or until it is on a different plane of existence from the target. The {@condition charmed} target is under Acythylass' control and can't take reactions, and Acythylass and the target can communicate telepathically with each other over any distance.

Whenever the {@condition charmed} target takes damage, the target can repeat the saving throw. On a success, the effect ends. No more than once every 24 hours, the target can also repeat the saving throw when it is at least 1 mile away from Acythylass.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: Acythylass makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Tail Swipe
entries: Acythylass makes one tail attack.

legendary.name: Psychic Drain (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: One creature {@condition charmed} by Acythylass takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage, and Acythylass regains hit points equal to the damage the creature takes.

Acythylass' Lair Actions While inside their lair, Acythylass can invoke the ambient magic to take lair actions. On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Acythylass takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects:

- Acythylass casts {@spell suggestion} (no components required) on any number of creatures it can see within 60 feet of it. While maintaining concentration on this effect, Acythylass can't take other lair actions. If a target succeeds on the saving throw or if the effect ends for it, the target is immune to this suggestion lair action for the next 24 hours, although such a creature can choose to be affected.

- Pools of water within 90 feet of Acythylass surge outward in a grasping tide. Any creature on the ground within 20 feet of such a pool must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 20 feet into the water and knocked {@condition prone}. Acythylass can't use this lair action again until it has used a different one.

- Water in Acytyhlass' lair magically becomes a conduit for the creature's rage. Acythylass can target any number of creatures it can see in such water within 90 feet of it. A target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage. Acythylass can't use this lair action again until it has used a different one.

trait.name: Devoted Servant
entries: While the cecaelia is within 60 feet of Acythylass or Greylythoon, they have advantage on saving throws and ability checks, and deal critical damage on attack rolls of 19 or 20.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: While out of water, the cecaelia can hold its breath for 1 hour.

trait.name: Underwater Camouflage
entries: The cecaelia has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made while underwater.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The cecaelia can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cecaelia can make two attacks with its claws, or two attacks with its daggers if armed, and one attack with its tentacles.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength check or be {@condition grappled}. The cecaelia cannot use its tentacles on another target until this grapple ends.

action.name: Ink Jet (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The cecalia releases a cloud of ink that extends in a 10-foot-radius around it if it is underwater. The area is heavily obscured for 1 minute, though a strong current can disperse the cloud. After releasing its ink, the cecaelia can use the Dash action as a bonus action. All creatures within the cloud must make a successful {@dc 11} Dexterity save or be {@condition blinded} until the end of their next turn.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Fargrim Snuffbottom is a 9th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). Fargrim has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Gnome Cunning
entries: Fargrim Snuffbottom has advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

action.name: Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit 5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Greylythoon can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Mucus Cloud
entries: While underwater, Greylythoon  is surrounded by transformative mucus. A creature that touches Greylythoon or that hits them with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature is diseased for {@dice 1d4} hours. The diseased creature can breathe only underwater.

trait.name: Probing Telepathy
entries: If a creature communicates telepathically with Greylythoon, Greylythoon learns the creature's greatest desires if Greylythoon can see the creature.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Greylythoon makes three tentacle attacks.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or become diseased. The disease has no effect for 1 minute and can be removed by any magic that cures disease. After 1 minute, the diseased creature's skin becomes translucent and slimy, the creature can't regain hit points unless it is underwater, and the disease can be removed only by heal or another disease-curing spell of 4th-level or higher. When the creature is outside a body of water, it takes 6 ({@damage 1d12}) acid damage every 10 minutes unless moisture is applied to the skin before 10 minutes have passed.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Enslave (3/Day)
entries: Greylythoon targets one creature they can see within 30 feet of them. The target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or be magically {@condition charmed} by Greylythoon until Greylythoon dies or until it is on a different plane of existence from the target. The {@condition charmed} target is under Greylythoon's control and can't take reactions, and Greylythoon and the target can communicate telepathically with each other over any distance.

Whenever the {@condition charmed} target takes damage, the target can repeat the saving throw. On a success, the effect ends. No more than once every 24 hours, the target can also repeat the saving throw when it is at least 1 mile away from Greylythoon.

monster.name: Servitor
languages: understands Common and Deep Speech but can't speak

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The servitor can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Devoted Servant
entries: While the servitor is within 60 feet of Acythylass or Greylythoon, they have advantage on saving throws and ability checks, and deal critical damage on attack rolls of 19 or 20.

trait.name: Mucus Dependency
entries: The servitor is permanently diseased, and can only regain hit points while underwater. When the servitor is outside a body of water, it takes 6 ({@damage 1d12}) acid damage every 10 minutes unless moisture is applied to its skin before 10 minutes have passed.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The servitor makes two longsword or harpoon attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Harpoon
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage. The target must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, or the harpoon is embedded in its body. While embedded, the target's movement speed is reduced by half and it takes 1 point of slashing damage it it uses an action. The harpoon can be removed with a successful {@dc 13} Dexterity check, and on a success the target takes an additional 2 ({@damage 1d4}) slashing damage.

entries.name: Damage Immunities:
entries: poison, psychic

entries.name: Damage Resistances:
entries: piercing

The ancient ballista is a massive crossbow that fires heavy bolts. Before it can be fired, it must be loaded and aimed. It takes one action to load the weapon, one action to aim it, and one action to fire it.

entries.name: Bolt
entries: Ranged Weapon {@action Attack}: +6 to hit, range 600/900 ft., one target. Hit: 27 ({@damage 5d10}) piercing damage. The target must succeed on a {@b {@dc 19} Dexterity} saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target fails its save by 5 or more, it is impaled ({@condition incapacitated}) by the bolt. The bolt can be removed from an impaled target by another creature with a successful {@b {@dc 15} Wisdom ({@skill Medicine} or {@skill Survival}) check, but takes an additional 11 ({@damage 2d10}) slashing damage from the barbs on the bolt.

item.name: Sanguarite Amulet
entries: This amulet contains a pristine sanguarite gemstone encased in a gold frame with runic markings. While wearing this amulet, you have advantage on Wisdom saving throws.

While wearing this amulet, you can speak its command word while covering the gemstone with a drop of your blood as an action to summon an orc ancestral spirit. The orc ancestral spirit appears in an unoccupied space you choose within 60 feet of you. It remains as long as you concentrate (as if concentrating on a spell), to a maximum of 1 hour, or until it drops to 0 hit points.

While summoned, the orc ancestral spirit is friendly to you and your companions. It obeys any commands you give it, but only understands Common and Orc languages. If you fail to command it, the orc ancestral spirit defends itself against attackers but takes no other actions.
After the orc ancestral spirit departs, it can't be summoned again for 24 hours.

item.name: Genetic Changer
entries: On an attack roll of 20, this weapon changes the genetic makeup of the target if it is a creature. The creature automatically rolls on the Chronic Mutagen Exposure Effects table.

item.name: Lich Queen's Die
entries: A seemingly unremarkable, grimy six-sided playing dice that is a carved bone from the body of Nephetes-em-Xhakar, the Deathless Lady. This die has 2 charges and regains 1 charge daily at dusk.
You make direct eye contact with the target creature and cast the die in its direction, the result can be found on the {@table Lich Queen's Die Effect|gp_karthax} table.

item.name: Chalice of Unholy Blessing
entries: Any creature drinking from this chalice regains {@dice 1d4} hit points with a small sip. With a deep drink, they are restored to their maximum hit points, and make attack rolls and ability checks with advantage for 1 hour.

One hour after drinking from the chalice with a deep drink, the creature must succeed on a {@b {@dc 15} Constitution} saving throw or become cursed with an unholy blessing. While cursed, they have disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws until they complete a long rest.

The creature must succeed on a second {@b {@dc 15} Constitution} saving throw to complete any long rest, ending the curse on a success. On a failed saving throw, the creature takes one level of {@condition exhaustion}, and the effect continues. On three failed saving throws, the creature is reduced to 0 hit points and is reanimated as a ghast.

The unholy blessing may also be ended early with a {@i bless} or {@i remove curse} spell. Any undead creature who sips from the chalice regains its maximum hit points and makes attack rolls and ability checks with advantage for 1 hour, but does not suffer from the curse. The effect can only occur once per day.

item.name: Blazing Ruby
entries: A ruby worth at least 500 gp that releases a fiery inferno if shattered. Each creature within a 15-foot radius of the shattered gem must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 17 ({@damage 5d6}) fire damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. The explosion ignites nonmagical flammable objects in the area.
The ruby's enchantment can be removed with a {@spell dispel magic} spell.

item.name: Inmortui Enchiridion
entries: This book is made up of loose pages pressed inside a steel-bound casing with a silver frame and clasps. Written in Common, it appears to be one of the first renditions of translating Common into the Inmortui language. Inmortui, or the \"Rotten Tongue\" as it is referred to by the living, is the language of undead beings; intrinsically bestowed when whatever foul magic returns them to the land of the living.
After you've spent 144 hours studying the book's scribings, you learn how to read, speak, and write Inmortui.

item.name: Demon's Tunnel
entries: This unremarkable copper hoop is roughly the size of a large ring, and can be worn as such. Crafted by a lesser demon, this item is commonly referred to as {@i Trevor's Teleportation Tunnel}. Instructions for its use are engraved in Abyssal on the band.

While attuned, you learn how to read, speak, and write Abyssal if you don't already know how to do so. Additionally, You can toss the ring into the air while speaking one of the tunnel's command words: "blood", "sacrifice", "darkness", or "mystery". The ring will magically reshape itself, forming a frame 3-feet by 4-feet in size, and hover 2 feet off the floor, each corresponding to another area of Raz'Drexin's floor. Once a command word has been used to activate the band, a teleportation tunnel to another region of the floor will remain open for 1 hour.

item.name: Fern's Finicky Flask
entries: This glass flask is wrapped in bands of copper, silver, and gold, and has a stopper of solid gold. Long ago, a powerful magus grew weary of identifying the myriad of philters, potions, poisons, and other concoctions brought to them—thus they created this flask to aid in the identification of such liquids.

When a small amount of solution is placed within the flask and swirled, the flask glass will color according to the solution's properties. Harmful potions such as poisons cause the glass to tint black, potions with a healing or regenerative effect tint the glass green, potions that grant an imbiber resistance to some effect will turn the glass white, and otherwise neutral or harmless potions tint the glass blue.
The solution itself remains its original color. The flask will revert to its transparent state after 1 hour.

item.name: Ring of Ruby Tears
entries: While wearing this ring, you add an additional die of damage to any melee attacks you make while your hit points are under half their maximum. Additionally, your melee attacks are considered magical even if the weapon you are bearing is not.

item.name: Mask of Pretense
entries: This masquerade mask has 3 charges. It regains 1 charge each day at dawn. While wearing the mask, you can use your reaction to expend 1 charge, changing your appearance to beguile one creature of your choice that you can see within 60 feet of you. The form you take is determined by rolling on the {@table Mask of Pretense Forms|gp_karthax} table, which is plucked from the target's memories.

item.name: Greataxe of Fury
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. In addition, while attuned to this weapon, you deal critical damage on attack rolls of 19 or 20. On your turn, as a bonus action you can enter a rage as a Bonus Action (1/day). While raging, you gain the following benefits if you aren't wearing heavy armor:

items: You have advantage on Strength saving throws and skill checks.
When you make a melee weapon attack using Strength, you gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll.
You have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
You are unable to cast spells.

entries: The rage lasts 1 minute. It ends early if you are knocked Unconscious or if your turn ends and you haven't attacked a hostile creature since your last turn or taken damage since then. You can also end your rage on your turn as a bonus action.

{@b Curse.} This greataxe is cursed, and becoming attuned to it extends the curse to you. As long as you remain cursed, you are unwilling to part with the axe, keeping it within reach at all times. You also have disadvantage on attack rolls with weapons other than this one.

Whenever you enter a rage while the axe is in your possession, roll a {@dice d8}. On a roll of 1, you enter an uncontrollable rage, and focus on the creature closest to you that you can see, be it friend or foe, and mark it for death. You can no longer end your rage as a Bonus Action, and you are unable to attack any creature other than the target of your uncontrollable rage. The uncontrollable rage ends after 1 minute, if you are knocked Unconscious, if you haven't attacked the target since your last turn, or taken damage since then. If you are damaged by another creature, that creature becomes your focused target.

item.name: Orb of Bitterness
entries: This orb was crafted by Karthax to ensure the temperature of Jarl Hjálmŷr is kept at a frigid temperature. It is immune to physical damage and immune to all magic damage except fire. The orb drains the nearby environment of all heat, storing it within itself. A creature that ends its turn within 30 feet of the orb must succeed on a {@b {@dc 15} Constitution} saving throw, takes {@damage 1d6} cold damage and suffers one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

To attune to the orb of bitterness, you must succeed on a {@b {@dc 20} Intelligence (Arcana)} check. On a failed save, or if the orb takes 1 point of fire damage, the orb shatters and the heat stored within is violently released. Each creature in a 30-foot radius sphere centered on the orb must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes {@damage 12d8} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire spreads around corners. It ignites flammable Objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.
On a successful {@skill Arcana} check, you become attuned to the orb, and gain the following:

items: Your appearance changes - your eyes become blue, skin and hair pale white, and you are constantly covered in a glaze of ice, gaining a +1 bonus to your AC
You become immune to cold damage and vulnerable to fire damage
You are surrounded by an aura of cold - any creature ending its turn within 10 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw or take 2 ({@damage 1d4}) cold damage
You become able to cast the following spells (1/day): {@spell cone of cold}, {@spell ice storm}, {@spell wall of ice}

item.name: Candle of Scrying
entries: This finely crafted silver candle holder has a handle carved in the likeness of a dragon. While attuned to this item, you gain the ability to cast the {@i scrying} spell once per day.

item.name: Frostbrand Greatsword
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

You can use a bonus action to speak this magic sword's command word, causing the blade to transform into a shard of ice. This ice extinguishes all nonmagical flames within 30 feet of you. While the sword is covered in frost, it deals an extra {@damage 2d6} cold damage to any target it hits.
In addition, while you hold this sword, you have resistance to fire damage and are immune to cold damage.

item.name: Shield, +1
entries: While holding this shield, you have a +1 bonus to AC. This bonus is in addition to the shield's normal bonus to AC.

spell.name: Krul's Motes of Fire
entries: You summon eight (8) tiny motes of intense fire  that burst into existence centered on a point  within 60 feet that you can see. Each mote of fire pops into existence in a random 5-foot  square within a 30-foot radius of the initial  point. Any creature within the same square of  the mote when it bursts must succeed on a  Dexterity saving throw or take 3 ({@dice 1d6}) fire  damage.

spell.name: Krul's Unrefined Fireblast
entries: You extend your finger and a blast of fire  erupts centered on a point within 60 feet that  you can see. On a successful attack roll, a target  within 5 feet of the fireblast takes 13 ({@dice 3d8}) fire  damage. Any target within 5 feet of the initial  blast zone must make a Dexterity saving throw,  taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage on a failed save or  half as much on a successful one.

table.name: Acute Mutagen Exposure Effects
table.caption: Acute Mutagen Exposure Effects
rows: {@i You feel groggy and disoriented. Your vision becomes blurry, and others look at your eyes with shock.} The character's pupils have begun to turn jet-black and look like those of an insect. The character has blindsight to 30 ft., but has disadvantage on ability checks that rely on sight.

{@i You can almost begin to feel slight tremors in the air, and noises seem abnormally loud.} The character has no noticeable physiological change. The character can use the {@b Web Sense} ability possessed by Sryytyl's brood, but has disadvantage on ability checks that rely on hearing and is vulnerable to thunder damage.
{@i Your senses begin to seem much keener, as though your perception has sharpened somehow.} The character has no noticeable physiological change, but has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks.

{@i You feel a bit weak, slow, and generally groggy, as though sick.} Other characters notice a sickly green tinge to the affected character's skin tone. The character has disadvantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws.

{@i Your tongue begins to swell to an abnormally large size, constricting your mouth, making it very difficult to speak.} The character's face, throat, and mouth are significantly swollen. The character is unable to speak and cannot cast spells requiring verbal components.

{@i You feel violently ill very quickly, and spontaneously vomit the contents of your stomach upon the floor. You begin to feel incredibly.....warm.} Exposed skin of the affected character has broken out into pustules. The character makes all Charisma ability checks with disadvantage, and if it fails any saving throw by 5 or more, they spend their next action retching and vomiting.

{@i You feel oddly...good, despite being exposed to that nauseating fluid. Somehow you feel a bit...stronger.} The character has no noticeable physiological change, but has advantage on Constitution saving throws.

{@i You feel absolutely wretched after being exposed to the violet liquid that seems pervasive in this area. But for some reason you can hear and even....understand....the faint chittering of the loathsome creatures infesting this floor.} The character appears sickly to others, and has disadvantage on Charisma ability checks, but can interpret the language of the brood that resides on this floor.
{@i Covered in that disgusting violet fluid seems to have no effect on you.} No effect occurs to the exposed character.

{@i Revolting.....you took a spray of purple goo right in your eyes. Now everything seems blurry.} The character's eyes have become filmed over with a hazy film. They make attack rolls and any ability checks or saving throws that rely on sight with disadvantage.

{@i Revolting.....you took a spray of purple goo right in your eyes. Now everything seems to have a very odd glow about it.} The character's eyes have turned purple. They gain darkvision to a range of 120 ft., and the character can see the presence of magic within 30 feet of it. If the creature senses magic in this way, it can use an action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears magic, and the creature can learn its school of magic if it had the ability to cast spells prior to this effect. This ability can penetrate most barriers, but is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

{@i Everything seems disorienting. You can hear random murmurs in your head, which grow louder and louder. You begin to feel very confused, uncertain...very unlike your normal self...}  The character has no noticeable physiological change, but acts as though under the influence of the {@i confusion} spell.

table.name: Chronic Mutagen Exposure Effects
table.caption: Chronic Mutagen Exposure Effects
rows: {@i You awaken from your long rest, but something feels very, very wrong. Your body feels very heavy for some reason, and your skin is discolored and hardened.} The character's skin has begun to change to a chitinous exoskeleton. The character's AC increases by 1, but its Charisma ability score decreases by 2.

{@i You awaken from your slumber feeling unusually well-rested and energetic. But for some reason when you look at your arm, the veins are noticeably a different color.} Mutagen has spread throughout the creature's bloodstream. Each time the character takes slashing or piercing damage, any creature within a 5-foot radius of them must make a {@b {@dc 13} Dexterity}saving throw or have a 25% chance of being exposed to an acute mutagen effect. The character regenerates 1 hit point at the start of its turn, and their Constitution ability score increases by 1.

{@i You practically jump up from your rest, feeling nimble and light on your feet for some reason.} There are no noticeable physiological changes to the character, but their Dexterity ability score increases by 1.

{@i Your eyelids feel unusually heavy as you open them, and your vision is very unusual when you do so - as though you are peering at the world through countless glasses filled with water.} The character's eyes have begun to resemble those of an insect. The character gains darkvision to a distance of 60 ft. but their Charisma ability score is reduced by 1.

{@i For some reason you awaken feeling bright and sharp, almost as though simply being in this wretched place has granted you some new insight into life.} There are no noticeable effects on the character, however the gain they ability to innately cast one of the following random spells once per day: {@i acid splash, light, mending, minor illusion, poison spray, prestidigitation, produce flame, resistance.}

{@i You awaken, nothing unusual appears to have happened to you during your rest.} The character experiences no noticeable physiological effect, but is immune to the mutagen's effects for the next 24 hours.

{@i You awaken feeling lighter and more agile than when you lay down to rest. Looking at your limbs you notice they have begun to shrink and are beginning to sprout long, coarse, dark hair.} The mutagen has begun to change the structure of the character's limbs into a spider-like state. The character's Strength ability score is decreased by 1, but their Dexterity ability score is increased by 1, and they have advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) ability checks made to climb.

{@i You awaken and feel sickly....groggy, nauseous, and unusually weak compared to when you laid down to rest.} The character is noticeably pale, and is not responding well to the mutagen's effects. Their Constitution ability score is reduced by 1, and they only regain half their normal hit die during a long rest.

{@i Nothing seems amiss as you open your eyes. Not sure what everyone is complaining about.....} there are no physiological effects, but the character becomes resistant to poison damage and makes saving throws against being poisoned with advantage.

{@i As you begin to stir, the first thing you hear is your companions complain of your unusually loud snoring. As you turn to speak with them, the sight of you causes them to recoil in horror.} The character's mouth has begun to change into a set of mandibles similar to those of one of Sryytyl's brood. The character gains the ability to bite (Melee Weapon Attack, 3 (1d6) piercing damage plus 5 (2d4) poison damage) but their Charisma ability score is reduced by 2. The character's speech is accentuated with the clicks of the growing mandibles.

{@i You feel energetic and unusually attuned to your surroundings, as though your senses have somehow been heightened.} The mutagen has subtly improved the character's senses, despite no observable effect. The character gains proficiency with the Wisdom (Perception) ability check, if they weren't already proficient in this skill.

{@i You awaken from your rest as you normally would, but your arms feel heavier than normal. When you roll up your sleeves (or vambraces), you are alarmed at large, unusual growths on either forearm. You quickly jolt at the foreign growths on your arms, but as you do so, a spray of webbing painfully erupts from one of the growths and shoots across the room, impacting on the opposite wall.} The character gains the ability to use the {@b Web} action possessed by Sryytyl's brood, but each time they do they take 3 (1d6) piercing damage and their Charisma ability score reduces by 1 (minimum 3).

table.name: Lich Queen's Die Effect
table.caption: Lich Queen's Die Effect
rows: You take 2 (1d4) psychic damage and gain 1 level of exhaustion as you vomit out various stinging insects (a {@b swarm of insects}) that attack the target.

If the target has under 50 hit points, it immediately falls unconscious. At the beginning of each of its turns, the target must make a Constitution saving throw, ending the effect on a success. If the target fails three consecutive saves, it is reduced to 0 hit points and is reanimated as a {@b ghast}.
If the target has over 50 hit points, it regains its maximum hit points.
The target must succeed on a {@b {@dc 15} Wisdom} saving throw or be polymorphed into a {@b frog} for 1 hour. If the target takes any damage, it is transformed back into its original self.

The target gains advantage on attack rolls and deals critical damage on attack rolls of 19 or 20 until the end of its next turn. The target also becomes immune to cold, fire, and poison damage for the duration.
The target becomes blinded, poisoned, and invisible for 1 hour. The effect ends after the duration, or if you say the target's name before the effect ends.

table.name: Mask of Pretense Forms
table.caption: Mask of Pretense Forms
rows: An arch nemesis (if applicable)
A mundane bystander, unknown to the target
A colleague or teammate
A family member
A best friend or close ally

A love interest or lover
(if applicable)

table.name: Karthax's Quips
table.caption: Karthax's Quips
rows: Welcome to my tower, mortals.
It is truly an honor to have you explore my tower! I just hope you do better than the last party...
Many sights to behold in my tower, both grotesque and exquisite alike!
The wasteland rhino is certainly an unsightly creature, wouldn't you say? I can't believe one was rampaging in my portal room!
Free will is an illusion, woven into the fabric of this realm. All must bow before the entropy of the universe.
Perhaps there is more to you than I thought. Not so weak after all...
Why was that one paladin wearing chainmail? Because it's holey armor! (Karthax laughs)
Trust no one in this tower. Any and all might be friend or foe, though some might be both or neither.
There is no rest for any in my tower. Be always on thy guard....
Ah, Bloodseeker... probably misguided in his views, but who am I to say?
Concealed treasures I have no use for. Burden yourselves with them, should you choose, but greed can be a powerful enemy.
Sanguarite gemstones... Amusing what chaos greed over a simple pretty rock can sow.
Concealed treasures I have no use for. Burden yourselves with them, should you choose, but greed can be a powerful enemy.
Small creatures can harbor large secrets.
A six-limbed creature that eats gems you say? Simply delightful!
Alas, I see only one end for you, and that is the abyssal darkness of death. It stalks you slowly, relentlessly within these walls.
Squabbles among brethren... Don't any of you realize it's all meaningless?
Honor can be found even among thieves and treasure hunters. Don't judge others too hastily!
Mortals are so fragile, lick your wounds, curs, for greater challenges await.
I once witnessed Krul'Thunk get in a slapping match with themself.
Tried some of the delicious ogre's brew yet? If not, you're in for a treat!
Red liquid in a glass bottle? I wonder what it does?
Can ogres really be this dense?
Pah. The stench of those filthy ogres will never leave the stone of my tower.
Knowledge may be found in the least likely places, mortals. Search thy surroundings thoroughly...
You behave as sheep do, only they have more sense than it appears you have.
Dwarves are as rigid as the stone through which they delve. Easily manipulated, most of them.
Who knew an ettin could write legibly? It must have been his good half.
Even the dullest of minds can stumble across powerful magics. You might learn a thing or two here....
Spiders... Why is it *always* spiders?
Beware worshippers of hideous beasts—not necessarily the beasts themselves.
A hive mind...the next evolution of the mortal realm? I should hope not.
Curious minds must be tempered with wisdom lest they succumb to forbidden temptations.
Wizards who lust for power are an endless source of entertainment for me.
That purple goo is almost rhythmic.
Twins are so interesting to me—so alike, yet so different. Mine was quite the opposite of me.
The infestation of my tower must be cleansed! Go forth, weaklings, and see if you can eliminate this scourge from my walls!
If Sryytyl's floor was empty, I wouldn't miss it.
Alyryne, what have you become?
Unending life might seem a gift, but a curse it can be for those entombed.
Ware the dead, their motives differ not at all from the living.
The secrets of death, even one such as I hesitate to delve into.
When the tombs of the dead are grander than the homes of the living one might question the motives of so-called rulers.
Cunning are the stonemasons of yore, who constructed this mausoleum where I constructed this tower.
A simple die roll might change the fate of the mortal realm.
Those who seek power best be on their guard, for jealousy can cause the most loyal subject to waver.
Poor Raquel, he has been fighting those skeletons for some time. Won't someone help him?
The Wizen are ever so loyal... or are they?
Imagine the wealth one could amass if they lived forever!
Demons embody the worst of chaos, for their wanton destruction shall be the end of all living things if left unchecked.
Mortals are easily seduced by the power of greater beings - demonkind being the most manipulative of all.
Pain is a tool of those who seek submission and subjugation. It should not be so.
Pity the rambling fool, but trust them not one bit for their mind is shattered with horrors beyond comprehension.
Seeking balance in the realm? Arioch certainly has a unique perspective.
You will see the cost of making a deal with the devil.
The only truth in this realm is chaos. Law and order are but constructs of control.
Even the darkest shadow must flee before the dawn.
Forbidden knowledge in skin-bound tomes is best left untouched, for its corruption might spread unchecked.
A copper band with the power of teleportation? Amazing what demons can create!
One of three is mad with righteous fury, one lusts for power and death, the third is a curious enigma. Choose thy poison carefully.
Beware sifting sands and dangerous idols.
Round and round and round they go, whom they slay, no one can know.
The dead are always restless, but only the very mighty - or foolish - would seek to bend them to their will.
Piousness and rules blind one to the truth.
Unpredictability is so amusing. One can never quite predict the motives of the insane.
Does a shroud of illusion simply cover one's own imperfection?
How different can three siblings possibly be?
A mask that changes your appearance in the eyes of another? Isn't that the point?
Law.....an excuse for those who wish to maintain power for themselves.
The Jarl loves sagas. Maybe you should tell him one of your own?
Odd that Hjálmŷr keeps a raging fire pit in his dining hall, given his aversion to flame.
Beyond the bedchamber of a giant lies an artifact only the most powerful of sorcerers can wield. Are you worthy?
Fat little Borr and Rán are great servants, I just wish they'd stay out of the giant's mead!
Reanimated fallen creatures, the Draugr contain the spirits of Hjálmŷr's ancestors , or so he thinks.
I've always liked Rorak, but I feel he is not long for this realm...
Edmond the Red? How about Edmond the Coward? I'd watch your back around that one.
The fighting pit—such a barbaric tradition, but we must allow Hjálmŷr to entertain himself somehow.
The Greataxe of Fury is a prized possession of Hjálmŷr although odd that he rarely fights with it.
Should you end up fighting Hjálmŷr, I'd very much prefer that the Jarl of the Frost Giants keep his head. He has been here so long, this tower really wouldn't be the same without him.
The Everfeeding Serpent... What a gluttonous beast! I've lost count how many adventures it's eaten!
Does Veraetis even worship Khuzza?
Jouslir has sworn himself to the Everfeeding Serpent, even after it ate his hand. That's dedication!
I had high hopes for Tiarsus' band of adventurers, but now only her and Artuk remain. Here's to hoping you don't meet the same fate in the beast's belly!
Artuk looks like he can bend the bars that imprison him... I wonder what he is waiting for?
They say Khuzza is the last hydra.. Good thing I saved it, right?
These Khuzza cultists... They just stand around waiting to be fed to the great beast. Such is the life of a cultist I suppose.
The Mark of the Hydra is tattooed on Jouslir's chest. How do you mortals come up with such creative designs?
I wouldn't walk into any water where you can't see the bottom... Those mutated quippers sure are hungry little fellows.
Where does all the gear from past adventurers end up? I guess that gluttonous lizard is eating it as well?
Acythylass, the Ancient with unending knowledge? Please! None are more knowledgeable than yours truly. I'd put that beast to shame!
Having a few cecaelia about does wonders for decluttering a dungeon floor!
Although weak, Greylythoon is a cunning creature and shouldn't be underestimated.
Snuffbottom the curmudgeon, as I like to call him!
I hope you enjoy swimming...
Do not take the mind of the inhabitant of my basement lightly, mortal; it is nearly as formidable as I am.
The cantankerous little one is incredibly cunning, having survived several of my challenges despite being unremarkable of body. But maybe they will meet their match soon?
Beware any who might follow their own set of rules, for they are as mutable and fickle as the ocean.
I've seens Acythylass penetrate the minds of mortals as easily as it takes its leisurely morning swim!
Don't fight the riptide... It could be your salvation.
Think you'll be the first to survive the tower? That seems unlikely...

table.name: 1st Floor: Dhugar Bloodsinger
table.caption: 1st Floor: Dhugar Bloodsinger
rows: Alas, this floor is merely the first test of your mettle. Should you not succeed, I would be greatly disappointed.
It might seem a bit drafty, but this place of yore was once a hidden refuge for those who heeded my words.
Blood rituals are a dangerous first step into the darkness of demonkind.
I wouldn't dare think of jumping from this tower, were I you.
Fighting amidst one's kin - isn't that what brothers are for?
Orcs, like all mortal races, have their quirks, but one should never doubt their indomitable spirit.

table.name: 2nd Floor: Krul'Thunk
table.caption: 2nd Floor: Krul'Thunk
rows: Don't these sheep seem a little off to you?
Even the dull and dim witted have their stories. Judge them at your own peril.
The taste of mutton resembles that of mortal man, from what I've been told.
Taste not the ogre's brew, for it could lay waste to even my brethren.
Ware - the loud one is dim-witted but savage; the second only a fool would discount their cunning.
Even the lowliest of sheep has a tale to tell.

table.name: 3rd Floor: Sryytyl
table.caption: 3rd Floor: Sryytyl
rows: Wait, are you actually going to drink that purple stuff?
Change of form often takes millennia, yet inhabitants here seem to be able to accelerate it. Fascinating!
The fluids within possess wondrous powers, should you dare to take a sip.
The pulse of giants is a steady thrum of power and life.
Sip not from the lifeblood should you be afraid of change, mortal.
SPIDERS! Burn them with FIRE!

table.name: 4th Floor: Nephetes
table.caption: 4th Floor: Nephetes
rows: Go forth with humility on this floor mortals, lest you walk it endlessly.
Swirling sands and rituals of death await you here.
Not all stonework is as it seems.
One of the first inked translations of Inmortui awaits discovery.
These ancient beings believed jackals foresaw omens of the afterlife.
Did... did that wall just move??!

table.name: 5th Floor: Raz'Drexin
table.caption: 5th Floor: Raz'Drexin
rows: Beware demonkind. This is one of the last, and therefore most dangerous.
Careful which of the four you choose. Power and peril alike await.
Blue flames are the hallmark of demons. Beware the stench of sulfur as well.
Blood is a powerful gift of the living. Demons thirst for it in endless quantities.
Being subservient to the unholy certainly has its drawbacks...
I think you can trust the druid. Seems a good sort.

table.name: 6th Floor: Cataclysm Sisters
table.caption: 6th Floor: Cataclysm Sisters
rows: Nothing here is as it seems. Be on your guard, mortal!
Cute and dangerous are not mutually exclusive concepts.
One would think after millennia they might tire, but hatred is a powerful motivator.
Brambles and thorns and ice and sand and death...my, your visit here will be more than a little amusing.
Could these sisters be any more different?
The body of a penguin, but the heart of a lion!

table.name: 7th Floor: Hjálmŷr
table.caption: 7th Floor: Hjálmŷr
rows: The buffoon here sings endlessly of his own exploits. Pity he barely remembers what actually happened.
Warriors test their mettle in a pit of death; the wise avoid such infantile tests of strength.
Flames scorch beards so easily.
Grim dismemberment greets those stupid enough to challenge their host.
The mephits amuse me endlessly - they have such creative ways of sowing chaos within this floor.
I once saw an adventurer try to pet Varsúlfr. Big mistake!

table.name: 8th Floor: Khuzza
table.caption: 8th Floor: Khuzza
rows: The great wyrm ever hungers.
Last of its kind, I took pity on it.
Cults are often mere fronts for more nefarious visions.
At least you can expect a quick death - stench of breath, flash of teeth and darkness.
The blade armed one has little patience. Beware the zealot.
I wonder if those bars are quite sturdy? Humidity and iron seldom do well together for prolonged periods of time.

table.name: 9th Floor: Acythylass
table.caption: 9th Floor: Acythylass
rows: Go with or against the current - your choice, mortal.
Ichor and slime alike coat my walls....disgusting.
Beware....you are being hunted.
Peril awaits you in deep water... That, and possibly salvation as well.
Caution the offspring that takes after its parent.
I know not where the ebbs and flows of the water leads, but I doubt you could survive it regardless.
